ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: I came to the class with objectives to:1, reduce my accent2, make my language more preciseI am very glad that I have achieved much more than my original objectives through this course. Now, I am more confident to communicate.
Question 12The course was very valuable as I gained skills and new knowledge in the English language,which will enable me to improve my overall professional and academic backgrounds.
N/A
The course was excellent, the professor and the communication coach were unbelievably helpful and alwaysavailable.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The teaching of adequate "social skills" in the American culture and the academic world in general.
All the valuable knowledge about the nuance of communication
Great organization and the instructor is very experienced in teaching this course.
I like the presentation practice the most.
Practicums and group discussions were the best aspects of this course as students could practice what they have learned in class.
All of the skills taught in the course are beneficial for me to improve my communication skills
Both the class and the practicum
Excellent practice
To gain basic knowledge of English communication, including American culture

Students are encouraged to ask questions and the professor would always patiently answer all the questions. I feel comfortable asking questions and taking part in discussion and have learned a lot from it.
The Instructor and Communication Coaches
learned formal communication, net working, how to make presentation, write papers, emails, grammar.
This course provides not only how to communicate well but also which differences international students should know for better communication.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: I understand why the school required the students who didn't pass the language test to take this class. But it just hurts anyway. Everybody in school knows that I take this course because my English is worse than anyone else's, which more or less discouraged me from actively talking with other people.

Students would improve more through the class if the syllabus would be designed in a way that, the amount of information (content) reflects and matches realistically the amount of time which is available for the course.
N/A

Not the class but FES needs to have individual soundproof study boxes where students can practice their pronunciation alone without disturbing others around and without being disturbed. Those box could also help for the individual communication tests ( E-cap). The cluster computers are not always suitable as other students work around
nothing

I think we can have homework which is easier to quantify and it would be great if we could get feedback for every assignment. However I understand this would be very time consuming and probably we don't have enough teachers to do this evaluation for every student.
none
more time on grammar would be better and also some topics on different types of letter writing; how to begin and how to end.
More clear explanations on weekly assignments.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: I did not find the practicum particularly helpful in learning the skills. Of course, we can (and should) always practice on our own, but I did not find the practicum very helpful, as is amounted to hasty one-on-one sessions between the coach and the individual students whose turn it was for 5 minutes. Comments and suggestions by other students were not discouraged, but were only seldomly inlcuded into the teachings. It might be made more efficient by grouping students with similar strengths and needs, so you can advance at these particularly important aspects with more depth and speed.
Practicum part reflected the lecture material very well.
Yes, the relationship between the lectures and discussions was effective
They were very effective. In practicum, we applied the skills that we obtained during the class.
Yes, the relationship was effective
nothing
The relationship between the course and the practicum is effective. They focus on the same skill training every week.
Yes, all the discussion sessions were focused and practically organized to enhance our skills learnt from the lecture class.
Yes, they were very much relevant. the practicum sessions were especially useful.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: It really helps me in socialization.

I am from SOM. And I am glad that the presentation skills, social skills, and lots of other culture related knowledge learned through this course are very helpful for me to immerse into US professional environment. I hope I took it in my first year in Yale and I hope there is a course designed for SOM international students in the future.

Skills in global communication is a necessary tool to address environmental issues, given that these issues have gone beyond local and national levels. Given the place that is offered to the English language in politics, economics, conservation and academia, the course fitted well in my overall program
Because I am not a native student, this course really helps me to improve my communication skills.
Communication is essential for any career as we need techniques for our every day, class and business communication
Good for improving my English

This course is of great help for me as English is not my native language. It also helps me understand the cultural difference from different perspectives. This course lays the foundation for me to effectively take part in other courses.
learned how to make better and quality presentation and do net working
It was very useful to realize how specific knowledge on communication is required in professional fields.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I wanted to hone my soft skills and the conciseness and clarity of my conversational speech.
Required but I would like to take it even not required.
I wanted to improve my communication skills
Explained previously
It was a requirement after my e-cap evaluation
Because I did not communicate well in english and I aimed to improve my communication skills.
To improve my communication skills
To improve my English
it is requirement
I need to improve my communication skills in English.
To become a effective communicator in global settings.
my communication assessment made me to take this course.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes, but I, personally, would have preferred to cover more aspects or each of the aspects in more depth. However, I aknowledge that for many of my fellow students, the pace was just right.
Yes.
yes, it did.
Yes, for sure!
Yes, they did.
Yes. The knowledge/skills that I gained met my expectations.
the skills meet my expectations
Yes. I gain a lot from theory to practice of English
I learned more than my expectation.
Yes, I gained a lot of useful knowledge. But the keys to master the skills are practice. This is where I should spend more time.
Yes, it provided me a clear structure through which i will be able to continue to develop my speaking, listening and writing skills.
yes, they were awesome and met my expectations.
It was beyond my expectations in a positive way.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Some fellow students and I formed a Study Group to improve our speaking in addition to the practicum. In the end, I found this to be most helpful to implement the concepts learned in class.
I wish there can be more push on me to practice the skills we learnt in class.
It was very good because we can work on the concepts we learned in lecture in a smaller group

The advantage is that I can learn from others' strength and weakness through observation. The practicum session gives a very friendly atmosphere for me. The disadvantage is that we are from different background, and the topic used in our practice may be difficult for others to understand.

The group work was limited on group discussions. The advantages of the groups were that students could communicate on selected topics and identify the area of strengthen and weaken, and plan for improvement actions.
N/A
Receiving feedback and critiques from peers really helps
Feedbacks and comments from peers are precious
Advantages were get mor training what we learned from the class
The advantage of the group work is to share experience and perspective, which greatly enriches our own understandings.The disadvantage would be the limited time.

In our discussions and relative comparisons regarding the knowledge that we learn in class, we were able to understand better and practice together so that each other can improve communication skills.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Take it!

You should take the class with attitude of trying out different things, ask questions, and engage in practice. Just listening to the concept in lecture won't help you, only if you try to apply it in your daily practices of speaking, listening, and reading. It's a great course if you are feeling uncomfortable about communication!
Great course for English as a second language speakers.
I would encourage them to take the course
Do all of the homework for the practicum. They will help you to survive during the course and master the skills.
I highly recommend.
It is definitely a must for international students
It is really useful class, even if you are pretty good at English communication. You will learn a lot from lecturer and stundets
Spend enough time to practice outside the classroom.

All international students (non native speakers) should take this course in their first semester. I took it in my third and felt that it would have made things so much easier if i had taken it in my first semester.
it is a good course for those who is not a native speaker of English; and who wants to learn speaking.
